I disagree with the idea of banning books based on their content. Censorship can limit intellectual freedom, hinder open dialogue, and impede critical thinking. Instead of suppressing ideas, we should address the root causes of violence and hatred through education, discussion, and promoting diverse perspectives. By encouraging thoughtful analysis and fostering empathy, we can create a more inclusive and understanding society.

There are instances where the dissemination of certain ideologies through books can directly incite violence, discrimination, or hatred without providing room for constructive dialogue. In such cases, a temporary ban on these books can serve as a necessary measure to prevent immediate harm and protect the vulnerable members of society. Upholding the greater good and ensuring the well-being of all individuals should take precedence over the unrestricted circulation of ideas.
